cleaned.title: [BIP-820] Grant Maxis StableSurge v2 Parameter Change Permissions
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-820] Grant Maxis StableSurge v2 Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1973

# Summary & Motivation

As Balancer labs has deployed a new and improved Stable surge hook contract with version 2, we are requesting to be allowed to control the same parameter set as with the v1 version as per [[BIP-778]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-778-grant-maxis-stablesurge-parameter-change-permissions/6346). This includes following parameters:

* setMaxSurgeFeePercentage
* setSurgeThresholdPercentage

on all networks Balancer v3 is currently deployed on and operated by the Balancer DAO (Mainnet, Arbitrum, Gnosis, and Base). These are key parameters in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers which the Maxis have been managing with v1 and intend to continue to do so with v2. Note that these permissions were already granted for Avalanche during the respective wire-up with [[BIP-813]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-813-grant-permissions-for-latest-v3-chain-deployment-avalanche/6465).

# Technical Specifications

All action-ids associated with StableSurge v2 can be verified with the associated [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/commit/5958f3ad13bedba44d0808665ff2e683f1db1a82).

## Ethereum

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0xf38ecb07c88c5307ae7e207ff9f96c7707a6093a6abb7c5c61020119536cc236, 0x2b49aa01d0b0251c5fa59f092390a988da3dbdc3609dc3c4bc36a4491da73681] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Arbitrum

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig 0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0 will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0x7ed51e972f7682e8a513e8d697daf6179714308b17bffd3d972a34a8a86fe107, 0x3e5b3786c2433c83d82d4d118259a3cf5b7dd26b4f21c6c56115c2ce1cfa825b] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Base

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig 0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462 will interact with the Authorizer 0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a calling grantRoles passing: [0x01ef05374c39f0094ff2f8278f21a14a89ed025e8564c7a541d4f26ed9bd23fd, 0xccde3eb1bbf6269f3b1ff650d0e3bf089ad0a119c82f5e48db9761d64a346c77] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Gnosis

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig 0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18 will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0x6648ca4015a562c4110635d0f2f8f402af08c32926b73b04307f778a4662ea47, 0xa9902a51b5285acf6244965666f9096d34561241355f4bd05e099f319fe8fde1] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-790] Grant Maxis Role for Balancer Contract Registry
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1798

### Summary and Motivation 

Balancer has created a new registry contract called the Balancer Contract Registry in which we will add v3 contracts to.  This proposal seeks to grant the role for functions related to this contract to the Balancer maxis.  

### Technical Specification

The DAO Multisig on Ethereum, Base, and Gnosis will call the `Authorizer` ’s `grantRoles` function with the respective action id’s for the following functions to the omni multisig.


#### Mainnet
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0xc50be693f82453d6b7fbfabf52ae750e168eb530ce663aec7b2fe1c96cfdf381"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0xda5605d0e7c70ae825d1d2e45f0656490960542c725946cd5532909f723501b4"`
        `"deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0x534d9f0ca09366b50105b12a7492e9429c8621cf57c845195e7c6874fa413d03"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0xf539cbe9be426b500591a2dd63970d37952d95006d1039f35e731b4b52b33e73"`

#### Base
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0x0918fe18bf5dd7146d6ef70b2bc468e01847a23ebc248c46f0f3e860e760b95a"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0x4f36a3d4a5722964e73c1331cfbe74b0ce2717c92b0cb39e4e1bb402a34ce490"`
        `"deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0xff6339cb1834d4fd03de1defb693e9bdbaf87b32c6ef785e9c1e9306a13e0991"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0x6c32ca35628dd90c860faff8e24fa89e8ccb7546536eefc8365ceceb013efad1"`

#### Gnosis
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`
`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0x96933475aa135d9d02d175e3f20f420fb65595ebeade476edf970dd5fddda874"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0xdb3b99d52cd97741d98d8cf58982c82a1c7caee958ed94e5fcf909ba57ef27bc"`
       ` "deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0xa2ccd901b5d57e951d23051ad0a49e4127722628b5f0318468fae768fd6e4a02"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0xd7b567352ab1dc8647c52f123cd411b5b0d47dbd5a4c5a65d799d675cc6604f2"`

### Arbitrum
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`
`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"` : `"0x86f7150372eac1ea58a41e472ce008974af1af41c17a9d2b75dd1eb608f7f1e1"`
`"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"` : `"0xcd03479a888f646243549839f3e3e0a8541e4fadd747050ce030b54ae2e3f3ea"`
` "deregisterBalancerContract(string)"` : `"0x35d64fe29e697ddb438d402a641010dac7cf88c9c2f8609d657125377d3554a0"`
`"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"` : `"0xd222e876fa09fc854125c959257507aa6ad490d65a8b94721974e7cc8953f739"`

All action id's can be found in this repo https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/tree/master/action-ids

Edits:
- add Arbitrum
- assign BIP IDs

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-766] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs on Arbitrum One and Base
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-766] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs on Arbitrum One and Base
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1696

This is a repetition of [BIP-741](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-741-grant-v3-permissions-to-maxis-and-emergency-dao-multisigs/6220), where the DAO granted both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings permissions to the emergency DAO and Maxis multisigs respectively. Except now these same permissions are granted on the Arbitrum One and Base chains, following successful deployment there ([BIP-760](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-760-deploy-balancer-v3-on-base/6290), [BIP-761](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-761-deployment-of-balancer-v3-on-arbitrum-one/6294)).

## Emergency DAO

* `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
* `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
* `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
* `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
* `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
* `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
* `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
* `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
* `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
* `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
* `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
* `StablePoolFactory.disable`
* `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

* `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
* `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
* `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
* `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`
* 
Again a detailed list of the permissions as per the [proposed payloads](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1696), first for Arbitrum One then for Base:

raw.title: [BIP-788] Grant Maxi Multisig set_reward_distributor permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1797

Summary & Motivation

A crucial part of the Maxi operations is configuring reward distributions for injector and partner contracts on to pool gauges. Over time the Maxis have moved their primary method of ownership of injector contracts to the omni-chain multisig. To reduce the quantity and fragmentation of batched transactions, separate reviews, and to have a uniform process on all networks we propose granting permission to call `set_reward_distributor` via to the omni-chain multisig. This will allow reconfiguration of gauge rewards from an old distributor to a new one seamless along with the rest of the injector configuration process.

On Ethereum, the DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call `grantRole(bytes32,address)` on the authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` with the following arguments:

* role: `0xd0090a09f425bba74e6c801fba7c6d15b44147ab0bd319e40076ce07e95168b6` ([ref](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/346f78f1df91b7c910adda8a8e258861b8d452d4/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L727))
* account: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` ([ref](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses/blob/78e701eeca6d376b43a80684b5cfec50df0a971a/extras/multisigs.json#L11C19-L11C61))

It will perform the same action on all other chains where the omnichain multisig is deployed and does not have these permissions yet: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Gnosis, Optimism and Polygon.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal aims to grant the Maxis Omni-Multisig permissions for the new ProtocolFeeController v2 on multiple chains, allowing control over global and per-pool fee settings and finalizing the fee controller migration as per prior BIPs.
key_arguments_for: Grants essential permissions to manage swap and yield fees globally and per pool, which is necessary for protocol fee control.
Aligns permissions of ProtocolFeeController v2 with those previously granted for v1, maintaining consistency and security.
Technical specification ensures multisig calls on all relevant chains, completing migration safely.
Past similar proposals with 'Yes, let's do it' outcomes indicate community support for evolving protocol fee mechanisms.
key_arguments_against: No explicit opposing arguments surfaced in forum discussion or vote comments.
Low voting participation and limited discussion could imply lack of broader community engagement.

evidence.quote: Proposal summary and motivation by author 'Xeonus' stating granting permissions for Fee Controller v2 to Maxis Omni-Multisig across relevant chains.
Timeline analysis shows stable lead for 'Yes, let's do it' with all voting power favoring this option and high spike index indicating late but decisive support.
Market impact after voting window shows modest positive TVL and price changes, indicating neutral to positive reception.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline metrics show unanimous voting power support for 'Yes, let's do it' with stable lead and no opposition.
- Forum discussion is limited but neutral, with no negative sentiment detected, supporting the recommendation.
- Similar past proposals on protocol fee controls have been accepted with positive community and market responses, reinforcing the expected benefit.
- Market and TVL impacts post-event are positive, indicating the community and stakeholders likely view this change favorably.
- Recommendation aligns with forum sentiment, reflecting community views despite low engagement, and prioritizes durable protocol governance benefits.
